page.title: 05CHURCHES
page.content: St. Giles' has records dating back to 1540. The tower was added in the 14th. Century. The church was restored by the Victorians making the true age of the church hard to trace. Six bells formally at Hampton in Arden & cast in 1725 were turned, tuned & re-hung in a cast iron bell frame in St.Giles in 1977.The minute bell, the ancient Nether Whitacre bell, was cast in 1612. St. John's is thought to date from the 14th. Century. The Adderley family moved to the Hams Estate in the early 17th. Century. The church & Lea Marston were part of the estate. This remained so until the estate was sold to Birmingham Corporation in 1919. Many refurbishments were made during the Victorian Era. The parishes of St. Giles' & St. John's are united under one incumbent.
